value.halfverse: so that I do not offend with my tongue.
value.verse: I said, “I will keep watch upon my ways, *
I will put a muzzle on my mouth *
value.halfverse: while the wicked are in my presence.”

I refrained from rash words;
 but my pain became unbearable.
value.verse: So I held my tongue and said nothing; *

value.halfverse: I spoke out with my tongue:
value.verse:
My heart was hot within me;
while I pondered, the fire burst into flame; *
LORD, let me know my end and the number of my days, *
value.halfverse: so that I may know how short my life is.

value.verse:
You have given me a mere handful of days,
and my lifetime is as nothing in your sight; *
value.halfverse: truly, even those who stand erect are but a puff of wind.
we heap up riches and cannot tell who will gather them.
value.verse:
We walk about like a shadow,
and in vain we are in turmoil; *

value.halfverse: O Lord, my hope is in you.
value.verse: And now, what is my hope? *
Deliver me from all my transgressions *
value.halfverse: and do not make me the taunt of the fool.

value.verse: I fell silent and did not open my mouth, *
value.halfverse: for surely it was you that did it.
I am worn down by the blows of your hand.

value.verse:
With rebukes for sin you punish us;
like a moth you eat away all that is dear to us; *
value.halfverse: truly, everyone is but a puff of wind.
hold not your peace at my tears.
value.verse:
Hear my prayer, O LORD,
and give ear to my cry; *

value.halfverse: a wayfarer, as all my forebears were.
value.verse: For I am but a sojourner with you, *
Turn your gaze from me, that I may be glad again, *
value.halfverse: before I go my way and am no more.
